definition: to sit down
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]

sentences.english: Black men and white men Together at the table of brotherhood!
sentences.chinese: 无论肤色黑白，我们能同席落坐，情如手足。

sentences.english: I take the table in the bar’s back corner.
sentences.chinese: 我在酒吧的一个僻角找位落坐。

sentences.english: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down.
sentences.chinese: 在巴比伦河之滨，我们落坐。

definition: to be seated
to sit down/to take a seat
to seat (sb in a restaurant etc)/to take one's seat
to take one's seat
to exchange conventional greetings/to exchange pleasantries
to sit properly/to sit up straight
to pour wine or liquor
to send away/to dismiss (servants etc)/to retire from public life
to stand by in attendance
reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
guest and host
to sit upright
smiling/with a smile
smiling wholeheartedly (idiom); beaming from ear to ear
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to salute/to greet
